title: American_Top_40_1979_April_21st
description:
THIS IS THE LAST THREE HOURS OF A FOUR HOUR BROADCAST. THE FIRST HOUR IS MISSING.

American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This rebroadcast is one of many I have recorded from internet radio. A few are incomplete but most are not and I hope you enjoy these as much as I do.

In this broadcast:

Casey tells us whatever happened to the band known as The Turtles ("Happy Together").

There is a song in the countdown by a man who used to burn money for a living.

Casey answers the question, "Who is the biggest Country cross-over act in the 70's?"

Casey tells how one disco song in the countdown was written by a duo who told People Magazine that they don't like disco.

One artist in the countdown tried to bar men from attending his concerts, but discrimination laws wouldn't let him. Casey tells the story.
